intro: Antidesma fusicarpum, commonly known as the African starfruit or wild starfruit, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by distinctive, fleshy, star-shaped fruits that are edible. The fruit has a sweet, acidic flavor and is often consumed fresh or used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverine forests.
